rounds.observation:
[GAME] Hello Player 0! Let's play a friendly game of Tic Tac Toe.
The idea is simple: get three of your marks lined up in any row, column, or diagonal.
Just pick which square you want (they're numbered 0 through 8) and put it in brackets.
Like this: '[8]' puts your mark in the bottom-right spot.

You'll be playing with 'O' marks, and your friend is using 'X' marks.

[GAME] Current Board:

 0 | 1 | 2 
---+---+---
 3 | 4 | 5 
---+---+---
 6 | 7 | 8 

Available Moves: '[0]', '[1]', '[2]', '[3]', '[4]', '[5]', '[6]', '[7]', '[8]'
rounds.response:
Let's take control of the center to maximize our influence.

[4]

rounds.response:
Their last block was 7, so we have no immediate win on either the 1–4–7 or 7–4–1 line.  
But the leftover board now offers two **open** 2-in-a-rows for them:

 • middle row: 3–4–5 (contains 4)  
 • left column: 0–3–6 (contains 0, 6)

Both need **exactly one more O** to complete.  
Square 3 simultaneously finishes both of those lines, so we win regardless of how the opponent responds next turn.

[3]
